run_SORE.py main()¶

class run_SORE.DataPreparation(unprocessed_data_path='SORE/data/unprocessed_data/', output_folder_narrowIE='SORE/data/narrowIE/input/', output_folder_OIE='SORE/data/OpenIE/inputs/')[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates the path to the input dataset, as well as paths to write files that can be processed by narrow IE and Open IE systems.

start(max_num_docs_narrowIE)[source]¶

Start preparing the data for narrow and open IE, includes a simple pre-processing step in clean_content().

Parameters

max_num_docs_narrowIE – Maximum nr of documents to process at once with SciIE. This influences the time to pre-compute the ELMo embeddings for a large dataset (You should consider using a different model!).

class run_SORE.FilterPrep(input_file_dir='SORE/data/OpenIE/inputs/', output_dir='SORE/data/filter_data/')[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates paths to all OpenIE paths. Note that all .txt files prepared for Open IE will be used when training a SentencePiece model.

determine_output_name(prefix='test', SUBWORDUNIT=True, STEMMING=False, STOPWORDS=False)[source]¶

Determines the output name for the IDF weights and SentencePiece model & vocab. In order to be re-used.

Parameters

  • prefix – Experiment name.

  • SUBWORDUNIT – Boolean that determines whether to apply subword unit splitting

  • STEMMING – Boolean that determines whether to apply stemming

  • STOPWORDS – Boolean that determines whether to remove stopwords

Returns

start(prefix='test', file_names='OA-STM', sp_size='8k', SUBWORDUNIT=True, STEMMING=False, STOPWORDS=False)[source]¶

Start preparing the IDF weights (and possible the Sentencie vocab and model).

Parameters

  • prefix – Experiment name.

  • file_names – Prefix for files to compute the IDF weights for.

  • sp_size – string that determines the name of the sentencepiece vocabulary

  • SUBWORDUNIT – Boolean that determines whether to apply subword unit splitting

  • STEMMING – Boolean that determines whether to apply stemming

  • STOPWORDS – Boolean that determines whether to remove stopwords

class run_SORE.NarrowIEParser(narrowIE_data_dir='SORE/data/narrowIE/input/', narrowIE_predictions_dir='SORE/data/narrowIE/predictions/', RELATIONS_TO_STORE='TRADEOFFS_AND_ARGMODS', output_csv_path='SORE/data/narrowIE/')[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates the path and settings for the use of narrow IE predictions. The RELATIONS_TO_STORE parameter determines which narrow IE extractions you use for clustering.

  • ALL - Use all narrow IE arguments and relations found in all documents.

  • TRADEOFFS - Use all narrow IE arguments and relations found in documents where a TradeOff relation was found.

  • TRADEOFFS_AND_ARGMODS - Use only the TradeOff relations and their modifiers (in documents where a TradeOff relation was found).

start(input_filename, predictions_filename, output_csv)[source]¶

Iterates over the files prepared by DataPreparation, which is capped to a maximum number of input files. Convert the predictions outputted by the SciIE model to a csv format for clustering. Predictions have the format:

{“doc_key”: “XXX”, “ner”: [[[8, 8, “Generic”], [10, 10, “Generic”], [12, 14, “Generic”]]], “relation”: [[[8, 8, 10, 10, “Not_a_TradeOff”], [8, 8, 12, 14, “Not_a_TradeOff”]]]}

Parameters

  • input_filename – Single file with narrow IE input, to retrieve the sentence string.

  • predictions_filename – Single file with narrow IE predictions.

  • output_csv – CSV_file to temporarily store the relations found in predictions_filename

class run_SORE.SORE_filter(csv_path='data/narrowIE/tradeoffs_and_argmods.csv', sore_output_dir='SORE/data/processed_data/')[source]¶

Bases: object

Encapsulates paths to all processed Open IE files and the processed narrow IE CSV file.

start(prefix, filter_settings, IDF_weights_path, SUBWORDUNIT, oie_data_dir='SORE/data/OpenIE/processed/', sp_size=16000, number_of_clusters=50, stemming=False, stopwords=True, SUBWORD_UNIT_COMBINATION='avg', print_stats=False, path_to_embeddings=None)[source]¶
Starts the SORE filtering process, this includes embedding all narrow IE arguments for clustering, as well as

embedding all Open IE arguments to cluster with the same model, enabling cluster- and phrase-similarity checking.

Parameters

  • prefix – A name to identify the created files that store IDFweights, sentencepiece model and vocab, etc.

  • filter_settings – A dict with filter settings, retrieved from the settings file (e.g. SORE/SORE_settings.json).

  • IDF_weights_path – Path to the IDF_weights created during filter preparation.

  • SUBWORDUNIT – Boolean value that indicates whether subwordunits have been used during IDF weight creation.

  • sp_size – Size of vocab used for sentencepiece subwordunits.

  • stemming – Boolean that determines whether keyphrases are stemmed before filtering.

  • stopwords – Boolean that determines whether stopwords are removed from keyphrases before filtering.

  • SUBWORD_UNIT_COMBINATION – How the weights for subwordunits are combined to a single weight per word.

  • print_stats – Whether to print the statistics on unfiltered OIE extractions.

  • path_to_embeddings – Path where ELMo PubMed embeddings can be found.

run_SORE.main(all_settings)[source]¶

Run Semi-Open Relation Extraction code following the provided settings file.

Parameters

all_settings – Settings-file provided - e.g. python run_SORE.py -s “path_to_my_settings_file.json”
